greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number k such that n + k is prime.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
M. Popescu, V. Seleacu, About the Smarandache Complementary Prime Function, Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 7, No. 1-2-3, 1996, 12-22.
F. Smarandache, Only Problems, Not Solutions!, via viXra.
example: a(22) = 1 because 22 + 1 = 23, the next higher prime.
a(24) = 5 because 24 + 5 = 29, the next higher prime.
a(25) = 4 because 25 + 4 = 29, the next higher prime.
mathematica: distToPrime[n_] := If[PrimeQ[n], 0, NextPrime[n] - n]; Array[distToPrime, 110, 0] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 19 2011 *)
xref: Cf. A064722, A013632 (a slightly different version).
results.author: R. Muller
ext: More terms from Joanna S. Bartlett (s1117611(AT)cedarville.edu)
